alert.note: Alert for Dundy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 6:09AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Nebraska, including the following county, Dundy. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding, including Highway 61 from Benkelman to Enders. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 505 AM MDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. Between 5 and 9 inches of rain have fallen. Localized significant flooding is possible including locations along the Republican River. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Max. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
